text.pollSent: WeAAve sent you an email with the codes (licences) for accessing the projects. If you havenAAt received these, please write to us at {{supportEmail}}
text.job: What is your position in the school?
text.known: How did you find out about bMaker? You can select more than one option
text.fillPoll: Please complete this form so that we can get to know you better
text.fillPolll: Do you want to discover how bMaker works? Complete the form and receive two free trial licences. YouAAll have access to two projects for three months, with no commitment.
text.pollFinishedOk: You can now use these codes (licences) to gain free access to the projects. WeAAve also emailed the codes to {{email}}

text.contest: Participate in the Odisea bMaker journey, win a Maker classroom for your school and contribute towards equal opportunities in education.
text.kits: The Zum Kits have been developed for use in Primary and Secondary education and they include all the components students need to create their projects and give life to their inventions.
text.contents: The content is organised by challenges, projects and sessions, with a didactic order that guarantees sequential learning. They will gradually discover how to overcome challenges using technology.
text.solution: bMaker brings the key technological skills of Primary and Secondary education into the classroom with ease and flexibility: programming, robotics, 3D design, Android app design and web development.
text.technology: With bMaker, they will go from being mere users to creators of technology, while boosting their creativity and developing skills such as critical thinking, problem solving and teamwork.
text.tryItfree: *Create your teacher account and get two free projects
text.platformOnline: On the platform, students work on their projects and check their progress, achievements and qualifications. What’s more, the teachers will have a complete and intuitive classroom management system, with additional information that facilitates their work.

title.contest: 1st Edition of the Odisea bMaker competition
title.solution: The Easiest and Most Enjoyable Solution for Teaching Programming, 3D and Robotics
title.technology: Educational Robotics, STEAM and Much More
title.platformOnlineSolution: A 360º Solution: Platform, Content and Tools

altImage.section6: bMaker Scratch, App Inventor and Bitbloq

text.part1: 65% of primary school children will have jobs that do not yet exist, according to the World Economic Forum. Innovation has never advanced so fast and technology will be the key to the exciting future that lies ahead. That is why our aim with bMaker is to prepare the children of today to become adults capable of creating it and applying it to their lives.
text.part2: In bMaker, we have combined the knowledge of Macmillan (leader in educational content) and BQ Education (a pioneer in technological education in Spain). The result is a tool that transmits our technological culture to the youngest and to society.

text.intro1: This is the privacy policy (hereinafter the “Policy”) for this Website which belongs to Macmillan Iberia S.A.U.
text.intro2: We will only use the personal data collected through this Website (hereinafter, the “Website”) in accordance with this policy. You will find information below on how we use your personal data, the purposes of use, who it is shared with and your rights in relation to said data.
text.part3P1: When you visit our Website for information purposes, meaning without registering for any of our services listed in section 4, and without providing personal data in any way, we may automatically collect additional information on you that will contain personal data solely in limited cases, which our server recognises automatically detects additional information, for example, such as:
text.part1P1: The following summary provides a quick general description of the processing activities that are carried out on our Website. You will find more detailed information in the sections mentioned below.
text.part3P2:
We only use this information to provide an effective service (for example, to adapt our Website to the needs of your device or to enable you to log in to our Website), and to gather broad demographic information anonymously and in aggregate form.
The personal data collected automatically is necessary for us to provide the Website, Article 6. 1. b) GDPR, and for our legitimate interest of ensuring the stability and security of the Website, Article 6 .1.1 f) GDPR.
text.part4P2: The information that is needed to provide the service is indicated as such. All additional information is provided voluntarily.
text.part4P1: Our Website offers an educational platform. You must create an account in order to use the service. In relation to registration of an account and its subsequent use, we process the following personal data:
text.part4P3: We will process the personal information you provide to:
text.part4P4: The legal basis for this processing is Article 6.1. B) GDPR.
text.part5P1: We do not use your personal data to make automated decisions that have legal consequences for you, or which could affect you significantly in a similar way.
text.part6P1: For statistical analysis, we use a tool called Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google to collect information on Website usage.
text.part4P5:
We use the personal data and contact details that you provide when registering to inform you directly of our additional products and services. The use of your personal data for direct advertising of related products and services is based in our legitimate interest as the owner of this Website, Article 6.1. F) GDPR.
You can object to the use of your personal data for direct marketing at any time. Once you have expressed your objection, we will refrain from any processing to the extent that it is related to these purposes.  You can inform us of your objection by contacting us via es.registros@macmillaneducation.com.
text.part6P2: The following summary provides a quick general description of the processing activities that are carried out on our Website. You will find more detailed information in the sections mentioned below.
text.part6P4: The legal basis for the processing is Art. 6.1. F) GDPR and it is based on our legitimate interest in analysing traffic on our Website in order to improve the user experience and optimise the Website. Google will retain the personal data collected for statistical analysis for a duration of 14 months.
text.part7P1: By local storage, we mean any file created by the website on your browsing device. Cookies are a form of local storage and you can find all the information in the Cookies Policy of this Website.
text.part6P3: The information generated on your use of the Website will be transmitted and stored by Google on servers in the European Union.
text.part7P2: There are other forms of local storage which are different to cookies and use the Website, which are as follows:
text.part8P1: This Website may contain links to third-party websites. We are responsible for the content and data obtained through third party websites; please check the privacy policy of these sites in order to obtain information on the data processing carried out on said sites.
text.part7P5: The local storage is necessary to providing the service correctly. If this functionality is blocked, the service cannot be provided.
text.part7P3: The purpose of local storage on the Website is to enable registered users to browse the platform using an identifier.
text.part7P4: The list of data stored in the browser is as follows:
text.part9P1span1: Your data may be disclosed to the companies of the Springer Nature group that Macmillan belongs to, which can be found via this link
text.part9P2: We may communicate statistics with aggregate and anonymous information on the users of the Website to describe our services to possible partners, advertisers and other reputable third parties, as well as for other legal purposes. However, these statistics will not include personal data.
text.part9P1span2: The legal basis that legitimises the disclosure of your data is the legitimate interest in meeting administrative requirements.
text.part9P3: We may disclose your personal data to the following services providers that assist us in providing the services offered via the Website: Mundo Reader, S.L. and Inmediastudio Comunicación, S.L., both of which are located in Spain. Said disclosure shall be based on agreements with the data processor. Consequently, our service providers will only use your personal data to the extent necessary for providing your services, and they will be under contractual obligation to only process your personal data on our behalf and in accordance with our requests.
text.part9P4: In the event of a restructuring or if we acquire a third party, any personal information we hold on you may be transferred to the restructured entity or said third party in compliance with the applicable law.
text.part9P5: We may communicate your personal data in the event of having the right or being under legal obligation to do so (for example, if a law or court order requires this).
text.part10P1: Reasonable security measures of the latest generation have been put in place to protect personal data from loss, misuse and tampering. For example, our security and privacy policies are periodically reviewed and improved as necessary, and only authorised personnel have access to the personal data. While we cannot guarantee that loss, misuse or tampering of the data will not occur, we will make every reasonable effort to prevent it.
text.part14P1: We reserve the right to modify this policy periodically by way of updates on our Website. Please visit the Website regularly and check our current privacy policy. This policy was last updated in May 2018.
text.part13P2:
You can contact our Data Protection Officer of the Group at:
 dataprotection@springernature.com.
text.part13P3: The information you provide when you contact us (for example, name or email address) will be processed in order to manage your request and will be deleted upon request. Alternatively, we will restrict the processing of that information in accordance with the data retention requirements set out by the law.
text.part13P1: Please email any questions, concerns or comments regarding this notice or any request relating to your personal data to es.registros@macmillaneducation.com.
text.part12P1: In accordance with the applicable law, you may have the right to exercise some or all of the following rights:
text.part11P1: We strive to limit our personal data processing activities as much as possible. If there are no specific retention periods in this notice, your personal data will only be retained for the time necessary to fulfil the purpose that it has been collected for and, where necessary, whenever it is required under the retention periods set out under the applicable law.
text.part10P2: You should bear in mind that transmission of data over the internet is never totally secure. We cannot guarantee the security of the information you submit through our Website while in transit over the internet and any submission is done at your own risk.

listItem.part7Li2: localStorage: it does the same as above, but remains even after the browser has been closed and reopened.
listItem.part7Li1: sessionStorage: maintains a separate storage area for each origin that is available for the duration of the website session (while the browser is open, including page reloads and resets).
listItem.part3Li5: information on your operating system, including the language settings;
listItem.part3Li6: location of connection to the internet.
listItem.part4Li2: Provide the services and information offered through the Website or requested by you;
listItem.part4Li1: Identify you when you access the site;
listItem.part3Li1: the type of device (PC or mobile), model of device;
listItem.part2Li2: Processing: refers to any operation carried out using personal data, such as collection, registration, organising, structuring, storage, adaptation, any type of disclosure or other use.
listItem.part1Li5: In accordance with the applicable legislation, you may have the right to exercise certain rights concerning your personal data (see section 12).
listItem.part1Li7: When you visit our Website for information purposes without opening an account, only limited personal data will be processed in order to provide access to the Website (see section 3).
listItem.part2Li1: Personal data: refers to any information relating to a natural person that can be directly or indirectly identified, especially by reference to an identifier, such as a name, an ID number, location data or an online ID.
listItem.part1Li4: We have implemented appropriate security measures to protect your personal data (see section 10) and we will only retain your personal data for the time needed (see section 11).
listItem.part1Li6: Our privacy policy complies with the provisions of the new (EU 2016/679) General Data Protection Regulation (hereinafter referred to as GDPR).
listItem.part1Li3: Your personal data may be disclosed to third-parties (see section 9).
listItem.part1Li2: Additionally, your personal data will be used for statistical analysis which helps us to improve our Website (see section 6). We will also enhance your experience of the Website through third-party content (see section 8).
listItem.part1Li1: If you register for one of our services (for example, educational website) or you sign up to our newsletter, more personal data will be processed in the framework of the provision of said services (see sections 4, 5).
listItem.part12Li2: To request rectification, erasure or restriction of the processing of your personal data, e.g. because (i) they are incomplete or inaccurate, (ii) they are no longer needed for the purposes that they were collected, or (iii) the consent that the processing was based on has been revoked, or (iv) you have exercised your right to restrict processing; in the event of the personal data being processed by third parties,  your request for rectification, erasure or restriction of processing will also be sent to said third parties unless this were impossible or involved a disproportionate effort;
listItem.part7Li10: Activity Pending: Save the activity you are working on.
listItem.part12Li1: To request (i) access and / or duplicates of your personal data, (ii) to receive personal data concerning you, in a structured, commonly-used and machine-readable format, and (iii) to transmit this data to another data controller without obstacles on our part; when technically possible, you will be entitled to transmit personal data directly to another data controller;
listItem.part12Li3: To refuse to authorise, without this affecting any processing activities that have taken place prior to such withdrawal or any other existing legal justification for the processing in question, and to withdraw your consent to your personal data being processed at any time;
listItem.part12Li5: To take legal action in connection with any possible violation of your rights regarding the processing of your personal data, as well as complaining to the competent data protection authorities; and/or
listItem.part12Li4: To object at any time to your personal data being used for direct marketing purposes, or - for reasons relating to your particular situation - your personal data being processed for other purposes;
listItem.part12Li6: Not to be subjected to any automated decision-making, including profiling (automated decisions based on data processing by automated means, in order to be able to assess different personal elements), which may have legal consequences for you or affect you in a similar manner.
listItem.part12Li7: You can (i) exercise the above-mentioned rights, (ii) raise any queries or (iii) lodge a complaint in relation to data processing by contacting us using the contact details provided below.

text.intro: Macmillan Iberia, S.A.U. (hereinafter, “Macmillan”), hereby gives notice that this website uses cookies. By using this website and accepting this cookies policy (hereinafter, the “Policy”), you agree to the use of cookies in accordance with the terms of this policy, which we have put at your disposal.
text.part7P2: Doing so will obviously have a negative impact on the usability of many websites.
text.part8P1: If you have any questions or comments on this policy, or if you would like to update the information that we have gathered on your preferences, please contact us:
text.part1P1: Cookies are files, which often include unique identifiers, which are sent via web servers to web browsers. They are sent back to the server every time the browser requests a web page from the server.
text.part1P2: Cookies can be used by web servers to identify and track users as browsers of different pages of a website and to identify users that return to the website.
text.part1P3: In order to make full use of the website on a computer, mobile phone or tablet, the user must accept cookies, as many online features have been designed to function when these devices are used.
text.part1P4: Depending on the amount of time that they remain active on the device, they may be “persistent” or “session” Cookies. A persistent cookie consists of a file containing the data which remains stored on the device and can be accessed and processed for a period determined by the entity responsible for the cookie, which may vary from a few minutes to several years. In contrast, a session cookie is a type of cookie designed to collect and store data as the user is browsing the website.
text.part1P5: They are usually used to store information with the sole interest of providing the service requested by the user on a single occasion.
text.part2P2: This application has been developed by Google, which provides the service of analysis of our website audience. This company may use this data to enhance its own services and to offer services to other companies. You can find out more about these other uses using the links provided.
text.part2P1: We use two types of cookies on this website:
text.part2P3: This tool does not collect personal data such as the users’ full names or the postal address of where they are connected to the internet. For example, the information collected relates to the number of pages viewed, the language, the social network our news is posted on, the city assigned to the IP address used to access our site, the number of users that visit it, the frequency and recurrence of visits, the length per visit, the browser used, the internet service provider or the type of device used to visit the site.
text.part2P4: We use the information to enhance our website, to identify new needs and to evaluate improvements to be made with the aim of providing users with a better service when they visit our site.
text.part3P1: These cookies do not contain any personally identifiable information, however, any personal information that you provide through this website which we retain on you could be related to the cookies. The cookies used on the website include those that are strictly necessary for access and browsing, cookies to track usage (performance cookies), those that remember your choices (functional cookies), and cookies that show you personalised content and adverts.
text.part3P2: This information is used for the following purposes:
text.part4P1: By browsing and remaining on the website, the user accepts the use of cookies under the terms and conditions set out in this Policy. Macmillan provides access to this Cookies Policy upon accessing the website so as to inform the user, despite the fact that the user can exercise their right to block, delete and reject the use of cookies at any time.
text.part5P1: When you use our website, you may access third-party websites and you could even receive third-party cookies.   They will use the information obtained from your use of their cookies to:
text.part5P2: In addition to the information provided in this Cookies Policy, the user can find more information on browsing options at
text.part4P2: In any case, as cookies are not necessary for using our website, the user can block or disable cookies by adjusting the cookies settings, which allow you to reject all cookies or some of them.
text.part6P1: The user can configure their browser so that they receive notifications on screen when cookies are received and to prevent cookies from being installed on their hard drive.
text.part6P2: Please refer to the instructions and user manuals of your browser for further information. However, we provide the following examples:
text.part7P1: You can also delete cookies stored on your computer:
text.listIntro: Click on any of the following links to access the relevant section:

listItem.part8Li4: Calle Rosario Pino 14-16, Planta cuarta, 28020 Madrid
listItem.part7Li3: On Google Chrome, you can change your cookies permissions by clicking on “Settings”, “Advanced”, “Site Settings” under the “Privacy and security” section. Click on “Cookies” under “Site Settings”.
listItem.part7Li2: On Firefox, you can delete cookies first, by making sure that cookies are deleted when you “Clear private data” (this setting can be changed by clicking on “Tools”, “Options” and Settings in the “Private data” window and then by clicking on “Clear Private Data” under the “Tools” menu.
listItem.part7Li1: On Internet Explorer, you must manually delete the cookies files.
listItem.part6Li3: On Google Chrome you can change your cookies permissions by clicking on “Options”, “Advanced”, then “Site Settings” under “Privacy”. Click on the Cookies tab under site settings.
listItem.part5Li3: Personalise adverts that may be of particular interest to you
listItem.part6Li1: On Internet Explorer, you can reject all cookies by clicking on “Tools”, “Internet Options”, “Privacy”, and enabling “Block all cookies” using the slider.
listItem.part6Li2: On Firefox you can block all cookies by clicking on “Tools”, “Options” and un-ticking the “Accept cookies from websites” box under the “Privacy and Security”.
listItem.part5Li2: Build a profile of your internet browsing habits
listItem.part5Li1: Track your browsing across multiple websites
listItem.part3Li6: To personalise our website to you, including targeted adverts that may be of particular interest to you.
listItem.part2Li1: Technical and personalisation cookies: They are proprietary and are necessary for browsing the website. These cookies do not store personal data and could be session cookies (in which case they will remain active while you are browsing the web page and are automatically deleted when you close the browser), or cookies with a duration determined by the owner of the cookie, which could vary from a few minutes to several years.
listItem.part3Li1: To recognise your computer when you visit our website
listItem.part2Li2: Statistical analysis and advertising cookies: These are third-party cookies, as the application that we use to obtain and analyse the statistical browsing data on our website is Google Analytics:
listItem.part3Li2: To track it as you browse our site and to enable the use of e-commerce facilities.
listItem.part3Li3: To improve the usability of our website.
listItem.part3Li4: To analyse the usage of our website.

text.zumJunior: A simple and safe kit for children aged 8 to 12 years. The components are resistant to bumps and drops thanks to their protective casings, the cables are easy to connect and disconnect with their telephone plugs and the tape fasteners allow the sensors and actuators to be joined as desired. In contrast with other kits, the Zum Kit Junior can be used to create hundreds of different solutions: their creativity is the limit.
text.zumAdvanced1: Aimed at children aged 11 and up, the kit is easy to use, resistant and safe. It keeps the board components and the electronics visible in order to offer deeper technical knowledge. It is not a toy, it is 100% real electronics!
text.learningTools: For centres that teach this subject, bMaker includes different kits for Primary and Secondary students, with all the necessary components for creating their projects.

text.free: Do you want to find out how bMaker works? Create your teacher account and complete the form to get access to two projects.

text.selectAccountType: What type of account would you like to create?

text.levels: bMaker is divided into 3 levels of skill, which are gradually acquired as the different challenges are resolved. At each level, they work with different tools and programmes.
text.projects: Each challenge consists of six flexible projects (so as to adapt to the needs of each classroom and centre), which follow a story where the students are the protagonists.
text.contents: Content is structured according to levels of skill, challenges, projects and sessions, with a didactic order that guarantees sequenced learning and teaches students how to find solutions using technology.
text.sessions: Projects are divided into five fifty-minute sessions which structure the process of learning and putting it into practice.
text.challenge2: They will create a time machine which will take them to the Jurassic Age (where they will develop a video game and a dinosaur robot), and Upper Egypt (where they will build a pyramid full of secret doors, traps and labyrinths).
text.challenge1: In their spaceship, they will arrive at an unknown planet. They will have to create various inventions, which include building a mock-up of a futuristic city in order to live in harmony with its inhabitants and the environment.
text.challenge3: In the near future, people will be printing their own objects at home and buildings will be designed directly in 3D. The problem is that the repository containing all the objects has disappeared. They will have to learn how to design and print their own constructions and contribute to creating a new repository.
text.challenge4: They will create a small tech company that will receive several commissions, such as robotising a haunted house, developing a robot programmed to pick up rubbish, or designing a robotic bracelet and a mobile app to control it.
text.challenge5: They will launch a new startup and create the entire website for a technological project devised to resolve one of the UN sustainable development goals.

text.validateAccount1: You are going to validate the account for

alt.classroom: Creating and managing a class in bMaker

text.classroom: bMaker includes all the tools that teachers need to manage classes in a simple and agile manner: they can create classrooms and groups, check and correct activities, evaluate using rubrics. They can view the projects and progress of each student and their group, grant or remove stars, etc.
text.complete: The bMaker platform is a powerful classroom management tool that facilitates formative action in teachers and promotes learning and student motivation.
text.motivation: Within the platform, students do not only work on their projects, they can also check their status, qualifications and achievements or the notes from the teacher. The objective of this ecosystem is to increase their motivation and desire to improve.
text.teaching: The platform includes additional information and content that facilitate the teacher’s work, such as the objectives, index of content and materials needed for each project or the map of competencies and the objectives for each session. In addition, other resources are included such as evaluation criteria, learning standards, methodological suggestions or guides and answer keys.

text.noClassroom: They have not joined any classes
text.isInClassroom: THE FOLLOWING STUDENT IS IN THE CLASS:

text.designThinking: Students develop their projects in phases, searching for a solution closely related to the needs of the potential users of the invention. This methodology boosts their creativity and their capacity to work in a team in order to create solutions collectively.
text.gamification: Gamification brings the dynamics of games to learning and converts it into a positive experience: it increases their motivation, enthusiasm and desire to improve while reinforcing their knowledge.
text.innovation: bMaker is a 100% digital solution based on cooperative learning and project resolution with a STEAM philosophy. The methodology is practical, creative and fun.
text.projectLearning: Every project is part of an open challenge which has more than one solution: each team has to find it according to their interests and concerns. This methodology allows skills such as critical thinking, communication and problem solving to be developed.
text.cooperativeLearning: Students actively build their own learning by working in small teams, where each member only reaches their objectives if the others do as well.

title.discover: Discover what you can do with bMaker

text.cantEditWithoutClass: You cannot edit the work unless you are in the class.

title.mustJoinClass: You have not joined a class that uses this project.

placeholder.title: Enter the project title.
placeholder.description: Enter a brief description of the project.

title.nextSteps: What are you going to do?
title.contentsAndStandards: Content, evaluation criteria and learning standards

text.noProgress: The teacher does not save the session progress.
text.confirmSubmit: Are you sure that you want to submit your answers?

text.checkMail: Check your inbox. If you canAAt find the email, it may be in the Spam folder.
text.changeEmail: Enter a new email address and weAAll send you an email.
text.instructions: We have sent an email with instructions to

text.headerPin: Your students will use this code to access the class until all places have been filled
text.shareCode: Share the class code with your students so that they can join the class.
text.needOneProject: You must select at least one project.
text.mustAddProjects: To create your first class, make sure you have added a project in My projects. You cannot create a class without any projects.
text.incompleteLicense: You must select 6 projects before continuing.
text.headerIntroLicense: Before you can create a new class, you need to use a licence so that you can assign content to the class.
text.headerNewClassroom: Lastly, give your class a name, and add an image if you wish.

title.selectProjects: Select the projects that you want to use with the class

text.newSpace:
Do you want to add this school to your list of schools? If you do, a new space will be created
          for this school.
text.newCenter: The licence you have entered belongs to a new school.
text.repeatedProjects:
You already have one or several of the projects that you wanted to add. Do you want to restart these projects so that you can do them again?
            If you restart a project, you will lose the progress you made in each one, including any stars that you achieved.
text.canJoinClassrooms: These projects are now available. Remember that you must join a class before you can work on these projects with your classmates.
text.textLicenseDetails: Check that you want to add the content below to the class.
text.canCreateClassrooms: You can now access these projects and add them to your classes.
text.selectProjectsToReset: Only select those projects that you wish to restart. If you donAAt select any projects, none of them will be restarted.
text.textFullLicenseDetails: The licence you have entered is a "Customised" licence. You can assign 6 projects to your class:

title.licenseCenterDetails: Details of the school linked to the licence

text.intro: Enter your current password and your new password
text.passwordChanged: Your password has been changed successfully. You can no longer access your account with your old password.

text.intro2: Please tell us their email address and we will send them an email with instructions.
text.intro1: Because you are under 14 years old, a parent or guardian must authorise this account within {{daysToValidate}} days or the account will be deleted.
text.emailSent:
Inform your parent or guardian. If the email address that you have entered is correct,
        they will receive en email. Ask them to check their Spam folder if they canAAt find it.

label.tutorName: Name of your parent or guardian

title.dontForget: DonAAt forget. There are {{daysToValidate}} days left

text.cannotJoin:
Before you can join this class, you need the following projects.
           You either donAAt have them or you are using them in another class.
text.askCode: Ask your teacher for the class code and enter it below.
text.noProjects:
You canAAt join a class yet because you havenAAt added
        any projects that you can use in the class.
text.invalidCode:
The code you have entered is not linked to any classes.
           Check the code and try again.
text.noMoreStudents:
Class full. Talk to your
teacher so that
           they can allow more students to join the class.
text.alreadyJoined: You canAAt join this class because you are already in it.
text.checkClassroom: Check that you want to join this class:
text.joinedClassroom: you must wait for your teacher to accept your request before you can access the class.

title.alreadyJoined: You are already in this class
title.joinedClassroom: You have asked to join the class

label.achievement: You are going to award stars to

placeholder.chooseReason: Give a reason for awarding the stars

text.underaged: Because you are under 14 years old, a parent or guardian must authorise this account within {{daysToValidate}} days or the account will be deleted.

text.noAchievements: You have not achieved any stars yet

text.pendingActivities:
One or several activities are not complete. If you quit
now, your progress in these activities will be lost.
